Pumpkin Chili

Prep Time:

<30min

Cooking Time:

30min

Serves:

4

Family Rating:

5 stars

Source:

Thug Kitchen Pumpkin Chili

Ingredients

  • non-veg: 400-500g of chicken

  • 1 yellow onion

  • 1 carrot

  • 1 bell pepper

  • 1 jalapeno (skip if too spicy)

  • 2-3 cloves of garlic

  • 1 tsp olive oil

  • 1 tblsp soy sauce or tamari

  • 2 1/2 tblsp mild chili powder (skip if too spicy)

  • 1 tsp dried oregano

  • 1 tsp ground cumin

  • 1 400g ounce can of diced tomatoes

  • 1 ½ cups of pureed pumpkin (I use 450g of frozen pumpkin)

  • 500ml of vegetable broth or water

  • 720g of cooked beans (I use 2x 300g cans of beans)

  • 1 tblsp lime juice

Preparation

  1. Chop up: onion + carrot + bell pepper into chunks no bigger than a bean

  2. puree the pumpkin if it’s a very hard one

  3. Mince up: jalapeno + garlic

  4. In a big stock pot: heat the oil over a medium heat.

  5. Add the veggies and sauté em till they begin to brown, about 5 minutes.

  6. Add the chicken + garlic + jalapeno + soy sauce + spices and cook that all together for another 5 mins (or 30 seconds if without chicken)

  7. Add the tomatoes + pumpkin + broth + beans and stir that up to everything is mixed.

  8. Get those flavors mingling and whatnot.

  9. Turn down the heat, cover, and let that simmer together for about 15 minutes.

  10. Stir it around every now and then.

  11. When it’s done simmering, turn off the heat, and stir in the lime juice.

  12. Serve right away with your favorite toppings.
